articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Sunday that the Russian army is making a pretence of an Easter ceasefire declared by President Vladimir Putin, continuing overnight attempts to inflict front-line losses on Ukraine.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy says Russian army 'trying to create impression' of Easter ceasefire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Orthodox faith is central to Putin's world view and he attends services during major church holidays.
articles.title: Putin attends Orthodox Easter service after declaring  ceasefire in Ukraine

articles.author: Andrew Chung, Luc Cohen, Kristina Cooke, Jack Queen
articles.description: The case raises questions about the Trump administration's adherence to limits set by the Supreme Court. It carries the risk of a significant clash between the two coequal branches of government and potentially a full-blown constitutional crisis.
articles.title: US Supreme Court temporarily blocks deportations of Venezuelan migrants under wartime law

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The paramedics and other rescue workers were shot dead on March 23 near Rafah and buried in a shallow grave where their bodies were found a week later by officials from the United Nations and the Palestinian Red Crescent.
articles.title: Israeli military review into killing of Gaza aid workers finds 'professional failures'

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: The U.S. State Department said on Sunday it would welcome the extension beyond Sunday of a one-day Easter ceasefire declared by Russian President Vladimir Putineven as the Kremlin said earlier there was no order for an extension.
articles.title: Russia-Ukraine war: US says it would welcome extension of ceasefire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Al Qaeda affiliate JNIM has said it killed 70 soldiers in raids on two military posts in Benin, the SITE Intelligence Group reported on Saturday.
articles.title: Al Qaeda affiliate says it killed 70 soldiers in Benin, SITE reports

articles.author: Joshua McElwee
articles.description: Pope Francis held a private meeting at the Vatican on Sunday morning with U.S. Vice President JD Vance, the Vatican said in a statement.
articles.title: Pope Francis, Trump critic, meets US VP Vance on Easter morning

articles.author: Yassin Kombi
articles.description: The DRC suspended ordered Joseph Kabila's assets seized over accusations of supporting Rwandan-backed rebels in the east.
articles.title: Congo suspends former president Kabila's political party

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain's King Charles and Queen Camilla briefly greeted onlookers after an Easter service at St George's Chapel in Windsor, an important fixture in the calendar of the monarch, who is supreme governor of the Church of England.
articles.title: King Charles and Queen Camilla greet crowds after Easter service

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A ship carrying wheat has arrived in Syria's Latakia port, the first delivery of its kind since former President Bashar al-Assad was ousted by rebels in December, the government said on Sunday.
articles.title: First wheat shipment since Assad's ouster arrives in Syria's Latakia
